Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Click + > Create expense > Manual. 4. Without entering amount, click Currency. 5. Type anything that will not return result. 6. Hit Enter. 7. Click RHP back button. BUG 1: Error shows up on amount input page. 8. Enter amount. 9. Click Currency. 10. Type anything that will not return result. 11. Hit Enter. 12. Click RHP back button. BUG 2: RHP opens confirm page instead of amount input page. ## Expected Result: BUG 1: No error will show up on amount input page. BUG 2: RHP will return to amount input page. ## Actual Result: BUG 1: Error shows up on amount input page. BUG 2: RHP opens confirm page instead of amount input page. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8644d610-091e-484c-9f40-318b62d04b50 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.87-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176922/test-cases/41237506 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.6.1 Chrome, iPhone 15 iOS 26.1 **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: Preconditions: use gmail accounts 1. Sign in to ND as User A 2. Create a workspace, enable Invoices 3. Switch to Classic in Troubleshoot 4. Create Invoice report, add an expense 5. Send invoice to User B, with whom you've never interacted before 6. When redirected to ND, open the created invoice room ## Expected Result: A message "invited @[User B's email] and an expense are displayed in the invoice room, which is the case if the invoice is created on NewDot. On top of that, the admins room states that only User B is invited. ## Actual Result: A message "invited @[User B's email] and @[User A's email] is displayed in the invoice room. LHN shows "invited 2 members". Expense is not displayed in the invoice room. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/10daff1b-db6d-444f-b564-27b8b838b40b [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Pass Page Context to Concierge from Side Panel

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
When a user chats with Concierge from the side panel (RHP), capture a simplified representation of the main app window content html and pass it as part of AddComment as a pageHTML parameter 1. When the user sends a message in the side panel from Concierge or the admins room 2. Capture simplified page html of the main body content (this would include things like semantic HTML elements (buttons, links, headings, menu items, inputs, etc.), visible text content from non-semantic containers, aria-label, href, alt, placeholder attributes where useful 3. Wrap the output with page URL ` ... extracted content ... ` 4. Pass to AddComment API. Add pageHTML parameter to addComment() function and only populate when isInSidePanel is true

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:**
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @nyomanjyotisa 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Open source](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C01GTK53T8Q/p1766554248072459)

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
- Workspace is connected with Company Cards
- Assign at least one card to a user, then unassign the card
1. Go to Workspace Settings → Company Cards
2. Observe the console errors
## Expected Result:
No hydration errors appear in the console
## Actual Result:
Errors appear in the console
- In HTML, <button> cannot be a descendant of <button>. This will cause a hydration error.
- <button> cannot contain a nested <button>.
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** N/A **Reproducible in production?:** N/A **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @quinthar **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Convert](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1766901205515449) ## Action Performed: **Issue description:** When a user opens a report link they don’t have access to, there is currently no clear way to request access directly from the UI. While this aligns with the security model, it’s not obvious to users and creates unnecessary back-and-forth to get access granted. ## Expected Result: Users without access see a clear call to action instead of a dead end. ## Actual Result: No option exists to request access from the report UI. ### **Proposed Feature:** Add a “Request Access” button when a user opens a report they don’t have permission to view. Clicking Request Access would trigger a Concierge/system prompt to the report owner (or appropriate approver/admin), such as: “[User Name] is requesting access to this report. Grant access?” - Yes - No ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
